isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Service Manual - Front Cover, Vibration Damper, and Gerotor Oil Pump - Removal - Front Cover

figure.caption: Removing the heater feed tube assembly hardware

step1.para: Remove bolt (M6 x 14) securing heater feed tube to front cover. Loosen nut (M10) at lifting eye bracket and slide heater feed tube from front cover. Remove and discard O-ring seal.
Remove all 17 bolts (M8 X 35) from the front cover.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, cut the sealant where the crankcase and lower crankcase meet when removing the front cover gasket.

Note: Failure to adequately cut sealant prior to removing front cover and/or front cover gasket, could cause gasket between upper crankcase and lower crankcase to be pulled out. Complete engine removal and disassembly will be required to replace the crankcase gasket.

step1.para: Two conditions can occur when removing the front cover. Use the appropriate procedure listed below.

step2.para: Condition 1: Front cover and front cover gasket are stuck together.

figure.caption: Cutting sealant between front cover and front cover gasket (condition 1)

step2.para: Use a thin blade scraper to cut sealant between the front cover and front cover gasket. Remove front cover and follow Condition 2 instructions.
Condition 2: Front cover gasket and lower crankcase gasket are stuck together.

figure.caption: Cutting sealant between front cover gasket and upper / lower crankcase joint (condition 2)

step2.para: Use a thin blade scraper to cut sealant where crankcase, lower crankcase and front cover gasket meet. Cut the front cover gasket loose and discard.
